NAME: Name
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_TITLE: Welcome to Luckets, a smart way to organize your life and do shit that matters
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_DESCRIPTION: Luckets is a method for living smarter, supported by cool technology, to help you live a bit closer to your real potential
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_TITLE: The first thing in this method is to define all the buckets in your life (luckets)
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_DESCRIPTION: Each lucket represent something important in your life such as: Health, Family, Mind, Money, Friends, Work, etc. Anything you care about should have at least a lucket. Do not forget anything. But do not worry, we will help you out by proposing the most typical luckets humans tend to use. Maybe you are not that different after all. When this is done, stop doing anything that does not belong to your luckets. That would be a waste of time
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_TITLE: After you luckets are defined, sincerely assess their status.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_DESCRIPTION: At Luckets we like simple. We use circles with primary colors to show the status of a lucket. Blue is perfection. You want to keep it like that, but make sure you do not overdue, other buckets may need you more. Green is pretty good but keep putting attention as you can still improve. Yellow is warning, it needs special attention, make sure you do something. Red is pretty bad, please do something asap.. White is neglect. You decide not to care about this lucket but that is still ok with your life. Maybe becuase that white lucket represents something nice to have but not critical to your life. Black is tragic. You need to stop everything else and take care of this lucket. Black is a show stopper.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you want to assess the status of your 'Health' lucket. If you feel fit, flexible, thin and nice but you still need to watch out your diet and your gym, put a green. Good job. If you are 5kg overweight, feel tired and having not going to gym recently put a yellow. If you are 20kgs overweight, have knee pain and cannot stop eating ice cream and smoking for breakfast, put a red. I would not use white here, your call, but neglecting your health is a bad strategy. I hope you never put black in this lucket. That is very sad, but may happen, specially is you do not stop that smoking. If you feel like the Dalai Lama going to the Olympics put a blue.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_TITLE: Add actions to your buckets and try to make then blue at the end of the sprint/week
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_DESCRIPTION: Similar to circles for status, we use colored squares to show the status of actions. The meaning is similar, but a bit different. Is common to have, say, a blue action for a red lucket. Blue means 'done' you should probably stop, otherwise it would be too much of a good thing. Green means almost done, something done, nice job but keep doing it if you have time. Yellow means not done, not started, needs attention. Red means that your action is actually causing or caused some harm, you did something but in the wrong direction, you made things worse, please fix asap. White is not done but you decided not to care, white is neglect. Black is not done and you should stop anything else to just do this.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5_TITLE: Now you know what do do. Try your best every day doing what you can. Carpe diem
